articles.author: Anita Olsen
articles.description:
I believe the most difficult thing I ever had to code was my web page. Not so much the one I have now but the layout I originally intended for it. I just never seem to be able to get it the way I want it. Ever since the arrival of the smartphone, websites have had to be responsive and look good on phones but this does not go too well with the type of look I am going for which is a classic late 90s/early 2000s website with a kawaii theme. I am positive I will figure it out with time as long as I keep at it though.
What is the most difficult thing you ever had to code?
articles.title: What is the Most Difficult Thing You Ever Had to Code?

articles.author: 1suleyman
articles.description:
Hey everyone üëã
If you‚Äôre just starting out with Git and GitHub, pushing your first local project online can feel like a big step ‚Äî especially when weird errors show up that seem like they're written in a secret developer language.
I just went through the full process of taking a local Git repository, linking it to GitHub, and solving some real issues (GH007, 403 errors, email visibility blocks ‚Äî all the fun stuff üôÉ).
Here‚Äôs the step-by-step I wish I had when I first started üëá
This is how you build the foundation of your project version control:
# Create a new folder for your project
mkdir git_practice
cd git_practice

# Initialize Git tracking
git init

# Add a README file
echo "Hello Git and GitHub" >> README.txt

# Stage and commit your first file
git add README.txt
git commit -m "Fir‚Ä¶
articles.title: üöÄ From Local Repo to GitHub ‚Äì Your First Commit and Push

articles.title: I appreciate the fact that this didn‚Äôt try to fix everything with a list of tools. It‚Äôs deeper than that, and more useful because of it.

articles.author: John Liter
articles.description:
Let‚Äôs cut to the chase‚Äîhow many of us are quietly burning out while still pushing commits?
You‚Äôre hitting deadlines. You‚Äôre responding to Slack. You‚Äôre reviewing PRs. From the outside, it looks like you‚Äôve got it all together. But inside? You‚Äôre drained. You‚Äôre anxious. You‚Äôre exhausted‚Äîand no amount of dark mode or dual monitors is fixing it.
In today‚Äôs tech culture, it often feels like grind is glorified.

"Side project or you're not serious."

"Learn a new stack every quarter."

"Open source on the weekends."

"Tweet your GitHub green squares or disappear."
But here‚Äôs the uncomfortable truth:

Many developers are silently burning out under the weight of unrealistic expectations.
The pressure to constantly grow, ship, learn, and produce isn‚Äôt sustainable. And what‚Äôs worse? We rarely talk about it until someone crashes.
Sure, passion is great. But it should fuel your creativity‚Äînot set you on fire.
We need to normalize sustainable dev life:
Taking breaks without guilt


Learning at your own pace


Saying no to that ‚Äúquick‚Äù favor


Logging off without needing to announce it







  
  
  Let‚Äôs Get Real




Have you ever hit burnout? What caused it?


What changes helped you recover or avoid it?


How can we design developer culture to value longevity over velocity?



You can‚Äôt ship good code if you‚Äôre running on empty. Let‚Äôs start talking about this before the crash happens‚Äînot after.
articles.title: Is Burnout the Default Setting for Modern Developers?

articles.author: Andreita Bello
articles.description:
Every day, millions of people around the world are greeted by the same, beautifully simple challenge: a blank 6x5 grid. It‚Äôs Wordle time. That first guess feels like a leap of faith. Is it better to load up on vowels? Target the most common consonants? Or just throw a random word out there and hope for the best?
While a first-try guess is pure luck, your starting word is the single most important move you can make. It‚Äôs not about guessing the answer; it‚Äôs about buying information. A great starting word is a strategic tool that dramatically narrows down the possibilities and sets you on a clear path to that satisfying all-green solution.
If you‚Äôre ready to move beyond random guesses and approach your daily puzzle like a seasoned strategist, you've come to the right place. This is your ultim‚Ä¶
articles.title: Cracking the Code: Best Wordle Starting Words

articles.author: nermine darwish
articles.description:
Understanding Integrated Workplace Management Systems (IWMS): Benefits and Definition
Why Integrated Workplace Management System Matters in Today‚Äôs Business Environment
Modern organizations face growing complexities in managing facilities and workplaces. With hybrid work models, sustainability mandates, and rising costs, the need for integrated, data-driven systems is greater than ever. Trends show a clear shift toward innovative, flexible platforms that help organizations achieve long-term value through automation, analytics, and strategic facility management. According to research from Verdantix, the Integrated Workplace Management System market is evolving rapidly, with increasing adoption of data-centric platforms to meet enterprise performance and sustainability demands.
IWMS
Cost Red‚Ä¶
articles.title: Understanding Integrated Workplace Management Systems (IWMS): Benefits and Definition

articles.author: Panduro Kuhn
articles.description:
Cultural activities are the heartbeat of our international society, granting insights into customs, art forms, and ways of life that differ from one locale to another. From the melodic sounds of folk music to the vibrant strokes of regional art, connecting with various cultures broadens our appreciation of humanity and builds a feeling of connection among individuals around the world. Whether it‚Äôs through attending local festivals, exploring galleries, or joining in workshops, the activities rooted in culture enable us to explore beyond geographical boundaries and engage in the vibrant mosaic of human creativity. 
As we start this journey through cultural explorations, we will uncover a range of global experiences that invite you to venture beyond your safe space. Travelers increasingly lo‚Ä¶
articles.title: Transitioning from Tunes to Creative Expressions: A Handbook to Cultural Experiences

articles.author: GitHubOpenSource
articles.description:
Quick Summary: üìù


cpdown is a browser extension that allows users to copy webpage content and YouTube subtitles as clean, formatted markdown. It utilizes Defuddle or Mozilla's Readability to extract the main content, removes unnecessary HTML elements, and provides a token count for LLM applications. The extension supports keyboard shortcuts and offers configuration options for markdown cleanup and user notifications.
‚úÖ Instantly converts webpage content to clean markdown


‚úÖ Extracts YouTube subtitles into markdown format


‚úÖ Uses powerful libraries for accurate content extraction


‚úÖ Offers customizable settings and keyboard shortcuts


‚úÖ Open-source and actively maintained




  
  
  Project Statistics: üìä



‚≠ê Stars: 50
üç¥ Forks: 5
‚ùó Open Issues: 0
‚úÖ TypeScript
Ever wished you could ‚Ä¶
articles.title: cpdown: Your New Secret Weapon for Web Content Extraction

articles.author: Kareem Itani
articles.description:
What Is an API Endpoint?


An API endpoint is an endpoint that you can hit, that results in a certain action happening, that can lead to the frontend.
For instance, if you go on Facebook and you get to your profile, what this does is it hits a  /profile page, this endpoint will take you over to your personal profile page for the specific user currently logged on.
An endpoint is essentially a thing you can go to, and it does something for you on the backend. This could be related to databases, scraping information, or other heavy-lifting tasks. It processes actions on the backend and sends data to the frontend or performs backend operations.
There‚Äôs this concept called MVC:
Model: This is the data object that you can fill up and want to return.
View: What the user sees at the end.
Controlle‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to make an api endpoint call

Planon IWMS
An IWMS integrates multiple functions such as real estate, asset management, space management, and energy tracking. Planon ‚Äì IWMS automates workflows, eliminates data silos, and enables data-driven decision-making, helping organizations lower costs and increase efficiency.
Key Benefits of IWMS for Facility Management
Enhancing Operational Efficiency with Facility Management
Automated Workflows: IWMS streamlines daily tasks like work orders, inventory tracking, and maintenance scheduling.
Improving Space Utilization with Space Management

Enhancing Maintenance & Asset Management
Preventive Maintenance: Schedule inspections and reduce breakdowns with ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Transforming Facility Management with Planon IWMS

articles.author: Mohit Bisht
articles.description:
Hello everyone!
I recently participated in the #AmazonQCLIGameChallenge, an exciting opportunity to build a game using the new Amazon Q CLI ‚Äì an AI-powered coding assistant from AWS. As someone who's always learning and exploring new tools, I decided to tackle a classic: a simple Tic-Tac-Toe game using Q CLI and Python.
In this blog post, I'll walk you through my experience using Amazon Q CLI to build the game, share my key learnings, and show you how you can try it out for yourself!
Your AI-Powered Coding Partner


Amazon Q CLI is a groundbreaking AI-powered command-line tool from AWS. Imagine having a knowledgeable coding partner right in your terminal, available 24/7. That's exactly what Q CLI offers!
It empowers you to write, debug, and explore code simply by chatting with it.
You can ‚Ä¶
articles.title: üéÆ Exploring Amazon Q CLI Building a Simple Tic-Tac-Toe Game
